HA100.name: World Art Appreciation
HA100.description: Examination of visual arts from around the world in a variety of forms and in their historical, cultural, and sociopolitical contexts.

HA101.name: Western Art from the Paleolithic to Medieval Era
HA101.description: Introductory survey of Western Art from the Paleolithic to the Medieval era. Key works, monuments, and stylistic trends.

HA102.name: Western Art from the Renaissance to Contemporary
HA102.description: Introductory survey of Western Art from the Renaissance to the Contemporary era, focusing on key works, monuments, and stylistic trends.

HA210.name: Medieval Art
HA210.description: Major works of art in the medieval East (Byzantium, Russia, and the Islamic world) and West (Europe) in their cultural context.

HA230.name: Renaissance and Baroque Art
HA230.description: Arts of the Renaissance and Baroque periods (14th-17th centuries) in Europe

HA240.name: Modern Art
HA240.description: The rise of modernism and its domination over tradition in 19th and 20th century art. Romanticism, Realism, Impressionism, Cubism, Expressionism, Surrealism and Abstraction, and Post-Modern art.

HA250.name: Arts of North America
HA250.description: Major developments and themes in North American arts (painting, sculpture, architecture, photography, textiles, ceramics, prints, and visual culture) from its pre-colonial origins into the mid-twentieth century.

HA251.name: History of Photography
HA251.description: Survey of the history of photography from its origins to the present focusing on the development of photography as an art form and the impact this medium had on both art and culture.

HA252.name: Introduction to Contemporary Art
HA252.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
HA252.description: International art in various media created during from 1960 to present and its sources in art history. Criticism and its relationship to the artistic and cultural climate

HA253.name: Native North American Art
HA253.description: A selective survey on the art of indigenous peoples of North America from pre-contact up through the contemporary period. The relationships between these art forms and the social, cultural, and historical factors that surround their production and contribute to their significance in today’s world.

HA254.name: Latin American Art
HA254.description: Latin America's cultural pluralism and art production beginning in pre-Columbian times and following through to the present. Various functions of art as well as the relationship between objects, artists, and the cultures from which they come.

HA260.name: Asian Art
HA260.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
HA260.description: Asian civilization viewed thematically through selected masterpieces of visual arts. Main trends of Asian arts throughout a range of time periods.

HA261.name: Modern Asian Art
HA261.description: Modernism, modern visual culture, and contemporary art across the Asian continent, including painting, sculpture, design, photography, popular arts, and new media, structured geographically and thematically, considered through a variety of historical, social, political, and cultural perspectives.

HA271.name: African Art
HA271.description: Survey of visual arts from the continent of Africa including ancient to contemporary architecture, sculpture, textiles, painting, photography, performance, and body decoration. Structured geographically and thematically, artworks are considered through a variety of historical, social, political, philosophical, and cultural perspectives.

HA291.name: Topics in Art History
HA291.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
HA291.description: Selected topics in art history and visual culture

HA389.name: Methods in and Approaches to Art History
HA389.description: Art historical research, methods of critical analysis, and the historiography of the field.
HA389.prerequisite: (HA 101 or HA 102) and (HA 260 or HA 271) and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
HA389.restrictions: Open to students in the Art History and Visual Culture Major.

HA401.name: Greek Art and Archaeology
HA401.description: Arts of Greek antiquity. The Bronze Age to the Roman conquest, including archaeological sites.
HA401.prerequisite: (HA 101 or HA 209) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

HA402.name: Roman Art and Archaeology
HA402.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
HA402.description: Arts of ancient Rome from the foundation of the city to the fall of the empire, including archaeological sites.
HA402.prerequisite: (HA 101 or HA 209) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

HA410.name: Selected Topics in Medieval Art
HA410.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
HA410.description: Issues in the study of Medieval Art. Extensive experience with museum collections.
HA410.prerequisite: (HA 101 or HA 210) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

HA430.name: Selected Topics in Baroque Art
HA430.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
HA430.description: Selected issues in the study of Baroque Art. Extensive experience with museum collections.
HA430.prerequisite: (HA 102 or HA 230) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

HA446.name: Impressionism
HA446.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
HA446.description: European art from the mid-nineteenth century through World War I. Monet, Renoir, Cezanne, Degas, Van Gogh, Seurat, Rodin, and others.
HA446.prerequisite: (HA 102 or HA 240) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

HA450.name: Selected Topics in Modern Art
HA450.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of every year
HA450.description: Origins of modernism and the major Western artistic movements of the twentieth century in their historical contexts.
HA450.prerequisite: (HA 102 or HA 240) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

HA452.name: Selected Topics in Contemporary Art
HA452.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
HA452.description: Art in various media created from 1960 to present and its art historical sources. Criticism and its relationship to the artistic and cultural climate.
HA452.prerequisite: (HA 102 or HA 240 or HA 252) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
HA452.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Art Education or in the Art History and Visual Culture major or in the Art History and Visual Culture Minor.

HA453.name: American Art, 1875-1940
HA453.description: Artistic production in North America from 1875 to 1940, in its cultural context.
HA453.prerequisite: (HA 102 or HA 250) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

HA461.name: Selected Topics in Modern Asian Art
HA461.description: Selected topics in Modern Asian Art which address current theoretical issues and intellectual developments in the field.
HA461.prerequisite: (HA 101 or HA 102 or HA 260 or HA 261) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

HA462.name: The Arts of China
HA462.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of even years
HA462.description: Chinese art from the Bronze Age to the 18th century. Ancient ritual bronzes, Han funerary art, Buddhist sculpture, and painting. Aesthetic and philosophical principles.

HA471.name: Selected Topics in African Art
HA471.description: Selected topics in African Art which address the current theoretical issues and intellectual developments in the field.
HA471.prerequisite: (HA 101 or HA 102 or HA 271) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

HA485.name: Foundations of Museum Studies
HA485.description: Activities, functions, and organization of museums. Changing role of museums as cultural institutions.
HA485.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

HA488.name: Museum Curatorial Practices
HA488.description: Methods and practices for the development, care, and use of museum collections in research, education, and exhibition activities.
HA488.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

HA490.name: Independent Study
HA490.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.
HA490.restrictions: Not open to sophomores or freshmen. Approval of department.

HA491.name: Special Topics in History of Art
HA491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
HA491.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings.

HA492.name: Special Topics in Museum Studies
HA492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HA492.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings.
HA492.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

HA493A.name: Internship
HA493A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HA493A.description: Supervised pre-professional field experience in art history or closely related field.

HA493C.name: Museum Internship
HA493C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HA493C.description: Activities, functions and organization of a museum.
HA493C.restrictions: Not open to sophomores or freshmen. Approval of department.

HA496.name: Museum Studies Internship
HA496.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HA496.description: A capstone course consisting of supervised professional experience in learning environments such as museums, zoos, botanical gardens, and historic homes.

HA498.name: Learning in Museums
HA498.description: Theoretical and practical approaches to understanding and enhancing ways visitors experience museums, zoos, botanical gardens, and other informal learning environments. Creating educational programs, exhibits, and media.
HA498.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

HA499.name: Senior Research and Professional Development Seminar (W)
HA499.description: Development of critical professional skills, including critical research and professional writing skills, resume/curriculum vitae, letters of application, grants, fellowship writing, communication and presentation skills. Opportunity to present research. Culminates in a symposium that centers on a collective theme.
HA499.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
HA499.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Art History and Visual Culture major.

HA499S.name: Senior Research Project in History of Art
HA499S.description: Independent research arranged in cooperation with faculty mentor.
HA499S.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Art History and Visual Culture major. Approval of department.

HA800.name: Seminar in Ancient Art
HA800.description: Intensive investigation of a topic in the history of ancient painting, sculpture, or architecture.

HA810.name: Seminar in Medieval Art
HA810.description: Intensive investigation of a topic in Early Christian, Byzantine, or Medieval art.

HA820.name: Seminar in Italian Renaissance Art
HA820.description: Intensive investigation of a topic in Italian art of the 14th, 15th, or 16th centuries.

HA830.name: Seminar in Baroque Art
HA830.description: Selected topics in the history of European art of the seventeenth and/or early eighteenth centuries.

HA840.name: Seminar in 19th Century Art
HA840.description: Intensive investigation of a topic in the history of 19th-century painting, sculpture, or architecture.

HA850.name: Seminar in 20th Century Art
HA850.description: Investigation of a topic in the history of 20th-century painting, sculpture, or architecture.

HA860.name: Seminar in Asian Art
HA860.description: Intensive investigation of a topic in the history of Asian art.

HA870.name: Seminar in African Art
HA870.description: Intensive investigation of a topic in the history of African painting, sculpture, or architecture.

HA890.name: Independent Study
HA890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HA890.description: Special project, directed reading, and research arranged by an individual graduate student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

HA891.name: Special Topics in History of Art
HA891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HA891.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on a group-study basis.

HA899.name: Master's Thesis Research
HA899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HA899.description: Directed research leading to a master's thesis, used in partial fulfillment of Plan A master's degree requirements.
